title: Why does new Warwick not have any quote interactions with items?
body: Most new or reworked champs these days have a plethora of voice lines they say when buying certain items, but it seems that Warwick doesn't.  Is there a thematic purpose to this, was it because there wasn't enough time to make them, or some other reason?  Just curious.

replies.body: There is a thematic reason. We thought it would be kind of absurd for a instinct driven bestial hunter to have a conversation with the shopkeepers.
He could be talking to himself tho. I'd expect at least an interaction with {{item:3072}}

Except, isn't he quite lucid/aware when he isn't smelling blood?

There's a few key items Warwick should clearly interract with {{item:3742}} {{item:1041}} {{item:3074}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3091}} just to name a few. By contrast of the fact that Warwick falls into a beastial state when trailing someone, this seems like an oversight.

He is half aware. He's generally half beast half man and loses the human half when he smells blood. The narrative designer is probably better to answer this and you should probably ask him when the AMA happens. I can say that he felt strongly that it was against his character to have item lines.
Any word on why he has taunts for Ahri? Is it just some "half man, half animal" kinda thing?

Does that technically mean that you're more likely to have a fluid, coherent game of chess with Sion than Warwick?

I would love to play chess with Sion.
{{champion:14}} "You can't hide behind minions!" *black rook to white pawn*

Though I know the work it'd require, could he just scream at the shop keeper everytime he buys something.

Shopkeeper: "Well, here ya g-..."

{{champion:19}} "AGGGGGGGGGGGHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH"
Is he being decoupled narratively from Soraka? He only has one interaction with her and it's not exactly... deep.
His interaction with her is a cheeky nod to his old lore, his lore is being decoupled from hers.
what about a paranoid war veteran that wants his own land? is that still a thematic reason?
Was it intended for his voiceover to be so lacking the first place?

maybe just add in grunting / angry sounds then? :X

or something like "FEAST..." after buying a blood thirster.

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=8aAu7kAc,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-01-16T16:20:30.974+0000)
>
> There is a thematic reason. We thought it would be kind of absurd for a instinct driven bestial hunter to have a conversation with the shopkeepers.

Is there a backstory to WW pre Singed or pre transformation?
Isn't it kinda weird for them to say things in general about items?
They didn't prepare enough money for the voice actor to do all the lines.
